thread.title: These Japanese Star Wars: The Force Awakens sand sculptures have to be seen to be believed - Movies
thread.title_full: These Japanese Star Wars: The Force Awakens sand sculptures have to be seen to be believed - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Ali Plumb
title: These Japanese Star Wars: The Force Awakens sand sculptures have to be seen to be believed - Movies
text: If you're heading to Japan any time soon and happen to be a Star Wars fan, be sure to check out these amazing sand sculptures.Built in the coastal town of Tottori, you'll be able to see R2-D2, C-3PO and a rather rotund BB-8 in specially-crafted silicon dioxide granules. © Getty Images 54-year-old sculptor Katsuhiko Chaen is the man behind the masterpiece, using 160 tonnes of the sandy stuff to create the work. © Getty Images The vital statistics: this bad boy is 3.4 metres tall, 7.4 metres long and 4.2 metres wide, and contains no mention of Anakin Skywalker, notorious sand despiser (as anyone will remember from watching Attack of the Clones). © Getty Images If you're worried you won't be able to make it to Japan before December, you'll be able to see the work in Chaen's sand museum, which is definitely really a thing. © Getty Images Star Wars: The Force Awakens is released in UK cinemas on December 17.
